title: Internal Dialog Scrambler
description: Jam any internal thoughts and dialogs that bother you

steps.title: Background
steps.description:
So there are some things you say to yourself over and over that don't make you feel the way you want yet, some of the most common ones are:

- *what if ...*
- *I'm not good enough*
- *you don't deserve ...*  

and before we turn this around you might wonder ...

answers.text: How is this going to work Adam?

steps.title: How this is going to work
steps.description:
I'm glad you asked,  
  so here's how it's going to work,  
  as I've been studying human behavior, organisms,  
  how society shapes behavior, communication,  
  and the greatest learning machine of all, the human brain,  
  I'm going to give you some things to try,  
  and whatever works for you, you get to keep,  
  whatever doesn't you file away in the  
  "thing's I've tried and haven't worked for me yet."

  Sounds good?

steps.title: Choose phrase
steps.description: Pick one the things you say to yourself which make you feel not the way you want, and write it below.

steps.title: Initial tempo
steps.description:
${echo}

When you have said this to yourself, do you say it in your normal conversational speaking voice, or is it said at a faster tempo?

steps.title: Initial tempo test
steps.description:
${echo}

Say this phrase exactly as you have done to date and notice how you feel in response to doing so
steps.inputPlaceholder: When I say this phrase to myself at normal tempo I feel ...

steps.title: Slow tempo
steps.description: Now I'm going to flash the phrase on the screen at a certain tempo, and for now just notice the speed, don't do anything else.

answers.text: I've noticed the speed, what's next?

steps.title: Slow tempo
steps.description: Now say this phrase out loud at the same speed I've just flashed it and notice what's different

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Slower tempo
steps.description: Oddly enough, now I'm going to flash the phrase on the screen even slower, and for now just notice the speed, don't do anything else.

answers.text: I've noticed the speed, what's next?

steps.title: Slower tempo
steps.description: Now say this phrase out loud at the same speed I've just flashed it and notice what's different

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Describing differences
steps.description: Describe the difference between the way you used to say it to yourself until now, and saying it to yourself like you do now

steps.title: Trying in vain
steps.description: as you try now to think of this as you used to, what are you noticing that is different?
